summary: Cappuccino is a popular coffee drink made with espresso and steamed milk, often topped with a thick foam. It gets its name from the Capuchin friars due to its color, which resembles their robes. The drink originated in Europe and has evolved over time. Initially, it was called "Kapuziner" in German, containing whipped cream and spices. Later, Italians adapted the name for their version, using espresso and milk. Today, cappuccinos are enjoyed worldwide with various flavorings and milk alternatives.
title: Cappuccino
